title: What are some less known facts about Marie Curie? - Quora

response.answer_text: Despite her two Nobel prizes she suffered from discrimination. In the intimation for her first Nobel her name was mentioned only after that of her husband Pierre Curie. After her husband’s death in an accident she had done the work which got her the second Nobel. Rutherford once commented on one of her papers that any undergraduate student can produce work of similar standard. She had an affair with a colleague after her husband’s death which was reason for her being deprived of the fellowship of the Academy of Sciences. She did not take enough precautions to shield herself from radiation which led to her untimely death. Even today her papers are preserved in lead-lined boxes.

Marie Curie also regarded as the mother of physics.. was the person to receive nobel prize both in physics and chemistry… Marie Curie died due to her own discovery after discovering the radio active element she always keep it in her pocket due to which she become widely radioactive and eventually died… also the notes of madam curie is still preserved in a chamber as they are still highly radioactive even after 100 of years..
